newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt revises upwards natural gas reserves.
newsitem.headline: Egypt revises upwards natural gas reserves.

text.p: Egypt has revised upwards its estimate of natural gas reserves to 30 trillion cubic feet from 24 trillion in March last year, an official at the oil ministry said on Saturday.
Estimates of crude oil reserves, however, remained unchanged at 3.3 billion barrels, the official added.
The official said that new natural gas discoveries had raised the government's estimates. "In 1996 alone, we had 20 natural gas discoveries," the official added.
Most of the hydrocarbon deposits discovered in 1996, in the Western desert and in the Mediterranean off the Nile Delta, have been gas rather than crude oil.
At current rates of extraction, about 832,000 barrels of crude and 1.3 billion cubic feet of gas a day, the crude should last about 11 years and the gas more than 60 years.
